Title.evidence: Enhanced Preoxygenation Protocol in Gastroscopy: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: randomly assigned to either the intervention group (enhanced preoxygenation) or the nonintervention group (standard care)

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were adults aged 18â€“75 years, scheduled for elective, diagnostic, and sedated gastroscopy.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to either the intervention group (enhanced preoxygenation) or the nonintervention group (standard care)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated the efficacy of an enhanced preoxygenation protocol in reducing hypoxemia incidence.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of hypoxemia (SpO2 < 90%) during the procedure.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 326 participants were randomised: 163 to the intervention group and 163 to the control group, between November and December 2024.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on 162 in the intervention group and 163 in the control group using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group had a significantly lower incidence of hypoxemia (6.5% vs. 25%, p < 0.001).

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
